Class RecipientLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • RecipientLine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecipientLineInterface

    public class RecipientLine
extends java.lang.Object
implements RecipientLineInterface
    Class representing line of donation recipients Uses queue data structure to keep track of recipients
    Author:
    benwiersma

      • toArrayRecipient

        public Recipient[] toArrayRecipient()
        Returns an array of the Recipients in the queue. Because of type erasure by the JVM at run-time, the array of type T that the generic queue returns from the call to queue.toArray() is an array of type Object, i.e., Object[] temp. But since the individual elements of the array are still Recipients, we can copy them one by one into a new array of type Recipient and cast each one to Recipient. So create a new array of Recipients of the same length as temp, run a for-loop that casts each element of temp to Recipient and copies it to the corresponding position in the new array. Then return the new array.
        Specified by:
        toArrayRecipient in interface RecipientLineInterface
        Returns:
        an array of the Recipients in the queue
